isoprocessor 0.2.1.9000
  • Reference

Visualize calibration parameters

Source: R/visualization.R

Visualize calibration coefficients and summary.

iso_plot_calibration_parameters(dt, calibration = "", x,
  select_from_summary = c(R2 = adj.r.squared, RMSD = sigma), color = NULL,
  shape = NULL, size = NULL, date_breaks = "2 hours",
  date_labels = "%d %b %H:%M")

Arguments

x

the x axis aesthetic for the calibration parameters, can be datetime, text or numeric
select_from_summary

which parameters from the fit summary to include, by default includes the adjusted R2 (renamed just R2) and the root mean square deviation (RMSD), which R often calls sigma or residual standard deviation (often also called residual standard error and root mean square error instead of deviation, or standard error of the regression).
color

variable to use for color aesthetic for the plot
shape

variable to use for shape aesthetic for the plot
size

variable to use for size aesthetic for the plot
date_breaks

what breaks to use for the x axis if it is a datetime
date_labels

datetime label pattern for x axis if it is a datetime

Contents

  • Arguments
